src:
Dodik: Prošlo je vreme medjunarodnog intervencionizma

02 Nov 2019, 11:10

Srpski član Predsednštva BiH Milorad Dodik izjavio je da će ga Amerikanci, poput specijalnog predstavnika američkog državnog sekretara za zapadni Balkan Metjua Palmera, označavati kao nekoga ko blokira "napredak" u BiH sve dok svoj interes u ovoj zemlji budu stavljali iznad interesa srpskog naroda u BiH, pa i ukupne BiH.Imenovanje Palmera za specijalnog predstavikaza zapadni Balkana, s jedne strane, i imenovanje Ričarda Granela za specijalnog izaslanika za pregovre Beograda i Prištine, s druge strane, Dodik je ocenio kao potvrdu da postoje razlike izmedju stavova Bele kuće i Stejt dipartmenta po pitanju ovog dela sveta, a ne odluke ili strategije da se SAD snažnije uključe na ovim prostorima."Čak je i u američkoj javnosti, onom njenom delu koji se bavi regionom zapadnog Balkana, pokrenuta polemika šta bi trebalo da znači imenovanje ta dva specijalna predstavnika i nisam siguran da je iko sa sigurnošću mogao da kaže šta će biti čija ovlašćenja", kazao je Dodik.On smatra da je politička snaga na strani ambasadora Grenela, koji je već ambasador u Nemačkoj, važnoj članici EU, i koji je blizak saradnik predsednika SAD Donalda Trampa."U BiH ne postoji konsenzus o potrebi njihovog prisustva ovde, mislim na pojačano prisustvo američkih predstavnika, da bi se rešavali problemi. Mada je potpuno jasno da bi deo političke scene bio presrećan da se SAD ovde angažuju na način da nameću rešenja koja bi voleli Bošnjaci", kazao je srpski član Predsedništva BiH.Prema njegovim rečima, tom delu političke scene SAD ne trebaju kao država sa kojom se može saradjivati u ekonomskom ili finansijskom planu, već im SAD trebaju kao zemlja izvoznica političkog pritiska, ako je moguće, kako je naveo, u njihovu, bošnjačku korist."Politika Donalda Trampa, i ovo što on javno govori ne ide u prilog nadanjima naših suseda u Sarajevu. I konačno, mislim da SAD kao globalna sila imaju i važnije teme i važnije probleme od BiH", smatra Dodik.Upitan da li blokada u konstituisanju vlasti BiH može da inicira mešanje medjunarodne zajednice u taj proces ili čak da organizuje neku vrstu medjunarodne konferencije o BiH, srpski član Predsedništva BiH je ocenio da je vreme takve vrste medjunarodnog intervencionizma prošlo.Dodao je da je ono što danas postoji u BiH "direktna posledica mešanja neizabranih stranaca u unutrašnja pitanja u zemlje"."Medjunarodna konferencija o BiH nije moguća ukoliko se o njenom održavanju ne dogovore sve velike sile, subjekti u BiH i regionu, kao što je to bilo u Dejtonu. Ne vidim spremnost tih sila da se o tom pitanju dogovaraju, u stvari ne vidim takav interes tih sila uopšte za unutrašnja pitanja u BiH", istakao je Dodik.Prema njegovim rečima, BiH jeste u krizi, ali ta kriza nije pretnja za mir i stabilnost ni u njenim granicama, a ni van njih.Upitan da li će, ako u Sarajevu ne bude postignut dogovor o formiranju Saveta ministara BiH, preispitati svoju poziciju u Predsedništvu, Dodik je rekao da bi odstupanje sa te pozicije bilo neodgovorno prema ogromnom broju gradjana koji su mu dali poverenje na izborima, bez ozbira što u toj instituciji ne može da sprovede svoje ideje o značajnijim iskoracima, koji bi značili bolji život gradjana.On je još kazao da je "slab interes" njegovog SNSD-a za ulazak u novi saziv Saveta ministara, jer su u periodu od izbora do danas na nižim nivoima, pre svega u raznim agencijama, imenovani ljudi koje su birale postojeće političke strukture."U takvim uslovima SNSD bi bio poput neke ikebane, neko drugi bi kreirao i provodio politike, a mi bi kao bili odgovorni za njih", ocenio je on.Upitan kakvu poruku regionu šalje EU odbijanjem početka pristupnih pregovora za Severnu Makedoniju i Albaniju, Dodik je rekao da su tom odlukom "demantovani zagovornici nepisanog pravila da svi putevi ka EU vode kroz NATO"."Odluka EU koja se odnosi na Severnu Makedoniju i Albaniju nas tera da razmišljamo da li je partnerstvo sa EU, koje je vidimo, ne sasvim pouzdano, jedini spoljnopolitički kurs koji smemo da zauzimamo. Da li treba da se odričemo parnerstva s drugim velikim silama i tržištima, kakve su recimo Rusija, Kina ili Turska", kazao je srpski član Predsedništva BiH.Govoreći o migranstkoj krizi u BiH, Dodik je kazao da mu migrantska kriza sve više liči na proces kolonizacije, koji je postojao na prostoru bivše Jugoslavije u prošlom veku."Migranti mi sve više deluju kao kolonisti, koji nisu ovde samo u prolazu, već je neko planirao da oni ovde i ostanu", ocenio je on.Prema njegovim rečima, problem migranata se primarno mora rešavati u EU, jer je EU otvorila južne granice, na području Bugarske i Grčke, a zatvorila severne."Ako zatvori sve granice,  migranti će ostajati na prostoru EU, koja mi deluje kao generator ovog problema. Predlažem da i migranti i novac koji EU nudi ostalim državama za zbrinjavanje migranata, ostanu na prostoru EU", naveo je srpski član Predsedništva BiH.
text:
Dodik: It's a time of international interventionism

02 Nov 2019, 11:10

BiH Presidency Member Milorad Dodik says Americans, like Special Representative of the US Secretary of State for the Western Balkans Matthew Palmer, will be labeled someone who blocks "progress" in BiH as long as they place their interests in this country above the interests of the Serbian people in BiH The appointment of Palmer as Special Representative of the Western Balkans, on the one hand, and the appointment of Richard Granel as Special Envoy for Belgrade and Pristina, on the other, Dodik said as confirmation that there were differences between the White House and the State Department. on this part of the world, not the decision or strategy to engage the US more strongly in this area. "Even in the American public, that part of it that deals with the Western Balkans has raised controversy about what the appointment of these two special representatives should mean, and I'm not sure anyone could say for sure what their authority would be, "Dodik said. He considers that the political force is on the side of Ambassador Grenel, who is already an ambassador to Germany, an important member of the EU, and a close associate of US President Donald Trump. "There is no consensus in BiH on the need for their presence here, I mean the increased presence of US representatives; to solve problems. Although it is quite clear that part of the political scene would be overjoyed that the US is engaged here in imposing solutions that Bosniaks would like, "said a Serb member of the BiH Presidency. According to him, that part of the political scene is not needed by the US as a state with which can cooperate economically or financially, but the US needs them as an exporting country of political pressure, if possible, as he said, for their Bosniak benefit. "Donald Trump's policies, and what he says publicly, do not support the hopes of our neighbors in Sarajevo. And finally, I think the US as a global power has more important topics and more important issues than BiH, "Dodik said. Asked if a blockade in BiH's constitution of power could initiate interference by the international community in this process or even organize some kind of international conference on BiH , a Serb member of the BiH Presidency, estimated that the time of this kind of international interventionism was over. He added that what exists in BiH today is "a direct consequence of the interference of unelected foreigners in internal affairs in the countries." maintenance is not agreed upon by all major powers, entities in BiH and the region, as was the case in Dayton. I do not see the readiness of these forces to agree on this issue, in fact I do not see such interest of these forces at all for internal issues in BiH, "Dodik emphasized. According to him, BiH is in crisis, but that crisis is not a threat to peace and stability. Asked whether, unless an agreement was reached in Sarajevo to form a BiH Council of Ministers, he would reconsider his position in the Presidency, Dodik said that stepping down from that position would be irresponsible to the huge number of citizens who they trusted him in the elections, regardless of the fact that he could not implement his ideas on significant steps in the institution, which would mean a better life for citizens. He further said that his SNSD's "weak interest" in joining the new Council convened ministers, because in the period since the elections to the present day, at the lower levels, especially in various agencies, people were appointed who elected the existing political structures. "In such conditions, the SNSD would be like some ikebana, someone else would move. asked what kind of message the region sends to the EU by refusing to begin accession negotiations for northern Macedonia and Albania, Dodik said that the decision "denied advocates of the unwritten rule that all roads "An EU decision relating to Northern Macedonia and Albania makes us think whether partnering with the EU, which we see as not reliable, is the only foreign policy course we can take. Should we forgo partnerships with other major powers and markets, such as Russia, China or Turkey, "said a Serb member of the BiH Presidency. Talking about the migrant crisis in BiH, Dodik said that his migrant crisis is increasingly resembling a process colonization, which existed in the former Yugoslavia in the last century. "Migrants are increasingly acting as colonists, who are not only passing through, but someone planned to stay here," he said. According to him, the problem of migrants it has to be solved primarily in the EU, because the EU has opened the southern borders, in Bulgaria and Greece, and closed the northern ones. "If it closes all the borders, migrants will remain in the EU, which acts as a generator for me. I propose that both migrants and the money offered by the EU to other countries for the care of migrants remain in the EU, "said a Serb member of the BiH Presidency.
